comment: Goated prof. The labs are pretty straightforward and he helps you set them up. Only grades you on sig figs and completion. Didn't make below a 95 on a lab report. And he tells you exactly how he wants them. Lets you leave whenever you're done. Walls and engages with students and plays some cool music. Final wasn't too tough but do study.

Dr. Colley is very good for lab, because he also teaches lecture, so he understands what you need to know to complete the lab. He is very strict on the lab book and grading lab reports. No participation grades. You will walk about knowing more about the subject than when you left, which I value.

The class material was hard to begin with since it is chemistry. However, Professor Colley did his best to answer questions and be any form of support. Even brought us donuts on exam day. If you take notes in class and complete the study guides ahead of time you can pass the exams. Super down to earth and just a chill guy.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Colley makes the class very enjoyable and easy. He gives clear instructions on lab. Your grade comes from pre-lab,lab reports, notebook and a final. Final brought my grade down.  !Be careful with sig figs on lab reports, you will lose lot of points!

Dr. Colley is an amazing professor. He goes an extra mile for his students. He makes material very easy and understandable. ACS exam what brought me down to B+. Weekly homeworks, 4 tests and an ACS final. Attendance is not mandatory but it helps a lot. He is willing to give extra credit.

He is a very good teacher, he stepped and taught me more than my non-existent chem teacher. He is hilarious, jokes around with the students, and we talked more about fantasy football  than chem. Take this guy if you want to pass.

Had him for both lecture and lab. Attendance isn't mandatory but you'll be a little lost if you don't attend unless you're good at teaching yourself. If you go to his office hours he will be more than happy to explain everything in depth. Likes to have conversations about pop culture and sports especially in lab so he makes lab more enjoyable.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Took him last semester he was very fun teacher. His class was hard, but it was only due to the fact that he is teaching chemistry. During lab he would clearly explain each step of the lab. Sometimes we would talk about fantasy sports so be prepare for those conversations.

Great teacher for both lecture and lab. He will help if you have any questions during the experiments and will always look over graded assignments with you during office hours. He can be slightly strict with grading lab reports, so make sure to ask any questions you have so you can make sure to get a good grade.

Dr. Colley was an awesome teacher! His lectures were easy to follow, and he will answer any questions you have. The content he teaches can be difficult, but he cares about student success and tries to help as much as possible. He notices effort, so it is beneficial for your grade to come to class, ask questions and attend office hours.

Friendly and laidback professor who clearly cares about his students. It was really easy to ask him for help, and he had tons of office hours available. 
Even though the material could be difficult, I enjoyed taking Chem 2 with Professor Colley.
He is an amazing teacher, he is willing to help even for lab, I actually get an A in the lab with his help. He also helps with homework. Very accessible outside of class. Answer to email really fast.

Great lab prof! He made lab fun. Had a really positive attitude and great energy. He clearly cared about the students. Prelabs helped a lot for lab report so take notes. Chem 1212L is hard so go to his office hours. He held office hours every day and was so helpful during them- big part of why I got an A. I would have loved him for lecture!

Know your sig figs and follow lab procedures and you will do fine (the only points I lost on lab reports were from sig figs). Lab reports are sometimes hard to follow but if you go to office hours he helps you do them. The final was also super easy. Slideshows before labs are brutal though they take like half an hour minimum.

Professor Colley is an okay professor to learn from. His lectures do feel very long sometimes, but he is always very enthusiastic about what he is teaching. His exam questions mostly come from the homework. His PowerPoint slides are just a copy and paste from the book, so if you were hoping for additional resources to study, you're out of luck.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class
